NAME: Luminescence
CITATION: Kreutzer, S., Schmidt, C., Fuchs, M.C., Dietze, M., Fischer, M., Fuchs, M., 2012. Introducing an R package for luminescence dating analysis. Ancient TL 30, 1–8. http://ancienttl.org/ATL_30-1_2012/ATL_30-1_Kreutzer_p1-8.pdf

NAME: RCarb
CITATION: Kreutzer, S., Mauz, B., Martin, L., Mercier, N., 2019. “RCarb”: Dose Rate Modelling of Carbonate-Rich Samples - an Implementation of Carb in R . Ancient TL 37, 1–8.

NAME: RLumShiny
CITATION: Burow, C., Kreutzer, S., Dietze, M., Fuchs, M.C., Fischer, M., Schmidt, C., Brückner, H., 2016. RLumShiny - A graphical user interface for the R Package ’Luminescence’. Ancient TL 34, 22–32. http://ancienttl.org/ATL_34-2_2016/ATL_34-2_Burow_p22-32.pdf

NAME: RLumModel
CITATION: Friedrich, J., Kreutzer, S., Schmidt, C., 2016. Solving ordinary differential equations to understand luminescence: “RLumModel”  an advanced research tool for simulating luminescence in quartz using R. Quaternary Geochronology 35, 88–100. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quageo.2016.05.004

NAME: numOSL
CITATION: Peng, J., Dong, Z., Han, F., Long, H., Liu, X., 2013. R package numOSL: numeric routines for optically stimulated luminescence dating. Ancient TL 31, 41–48. http://ancienttl.org/ATL_31-2_2013/ATL_31-2_Peng_p41-48.pdf

NAME: BayLum
CITATION: Philippe, A., Guérin, G., Kreutzer, S., 2019. BayLum - An R package for Bayesian analysis of OSL ages: An introduction. Quaternary Geochronology 49, 16–24. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quageo.2018.05.009

NAME: LumReader
DESCRIPTION: A series of functions to estimate the detection windows of a luminescence reader based on the filters and the photomultiplier (PMT) selected. These functions also allow to simulate a luminescence experiment based on the thermoluminesce (TL) or the optically stimulated luminescence (OSL) properties of a material

NAME: TLdating
CITATION: Strebler, D., Burow, C., Brill, D., Brückner, H., 2017. Using R for TL dating. Quaternary Geochronology 37, 97–107. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quageo.2016.09.001

NAME: tgcd
CITATION: Peng, J., Dong, Z., Han, F., 2016. tgcd: An R package for analyzing thermoluminescence glow curves. SoftwareX 1–9. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.softx.2016.06.001

NAME: KMS
DESCRIPTION: Collection of functions to simulate kinetic models for quartz luminescence production
CITATION: Peng, J., Pagonis, V., 2016. Simulating comprehensive kinetic models for quartz luminescence using the R program KMS. Radiation Measurements 86, 63–70. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.radmeas.2016.01.022

NAME: DRAC
DESCRIPTION: Online dose rate and luminescence age calculator
CITATION: Durcan, J.A., King, G.E., Duller, G.A.T., 2015. DRAC: Dose Rate and Age Calculator for trapped charge dating. Quaternary Geochronology 28, 54–61. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quageo.2015.03.012

NAME: Analyst
DESCRIPTION: The standard programme to analyse luminescence data
CITATION: Duller, G.A.T., 2015. The Analyst software package for luminescence data: overview and recent improvements. Ancient TL 33, 35–42. http://ancienttl.org/ATL_33-1_2015/ATL_33-1_Duller_p35-42.pdf

NAME: ArchaeoPhases
CITATION: Philippe, A., Vibet, M.-A., 2018. Analysis of Archaeological Phases using the CRAN Package ArchaeoPhases. Journal of Statistical Software 1–26. doi: https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v000.i00

NAME: RChronoModel
CITATION: Philippe, A., Vibet, M.-A., 2017. Analysis of Archaeological Phases using the CRAN Package RChronoModel. doi: https://doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.19659.59688

NAME: ChronoModel
DESCRIPTION: Chronological Modelling of Archaeological Data using Bayesian Statistics with an advanced graphical user interface

NAME: ESR
DESCRIPTION: R package 'ESR' for plotting and analysing ESR spectra in dating applications

NAME: gammaSpec
DESCRIPTION: A collection of functions to analyse gamma-ray spectra

NAME: DosiVox
DESCRIPTION: A Geant 4-based software for dosimetry simulations relevant to luminescence and ESR dating techniques
CITATION: Martin, L., Incerti, S., Mercier, N., 2015. DosiVox: Implementing Geant 4-based software for dosimetry simulations relevant to luminescence and ESR dating techniques. Ancient TL 33, 1–10. http://ancienttl.org/ATL_33-1_2015/ATL_33-1_Martin_p1-10.pdf

NAME: DosiVox2D
DESCRIPTION: A Geant 4-based software for dosimetry simulations relevant to luminescence and ESR dating techniques; simplified version in comparison to DosiVox

NAME: Viewer
DESCRIPTION: Proprietary software to visualise luminescence data recorded in BIN/BINX-files

NAME: Viewer+
DESCRIPTION: Proprietary software to visualise luminescence data recorded in BIN/BINX-files; sucessor of Viewer

NAME: PTanalyse
DESCRIPTION: Proprietary software to analyse TR-OSL data
CITATION: Lapp, T., Jain, M., Ankjærgaard, C., Pirtzel, L., 2009. Development of pulsed stimulation and Photon Timer attachments to the Risø TL/OSL reader. Radiation Measurements 44, 571–575. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.radmeas.2009.01.012

NAME: RLanalyse
DESCRIPTION: Proprietary software to analyse radiofluorescence data (BIN/BINX-file input required)
CITATION: Lapp, T., Jain, M., Thomsen, K.J., Murray, A.S., Buylaert, J.P., 2012. New luminescence measurement facilities in retrospective dosimetry. Radiation Measurements 47, 803–808. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.radmeas.2012.02.006

NAME: XRFanalyse
DESCRIPTION: Proprietary software to analyse XRF data recorded with a Risø OSL/TL attachement

NAME: RadialPlotter
DESCRIPTION: Java software to create radial plots
CITATION: Vermeesch, P., 2009, RadialPlotter: a Java application for fission track, luminescence and other radial plots, Radiation Measurements, 44 (4), 409-410. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.radmeas.2009.05.003

NAME: DensityPlotter
DESCRIPTION: Java application for Kernel Density Estimation plots
CITATION: Vermeesch, P., 2012. On the visualisation of detrital age distributions. Chemical Geology, 312-313, 190-194, doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.chemgeo.2012.04.021

NAME: MCDoseE
DESCRIPTION: Dose response curve fitting, dose evaluation for ESR dating
CITATION: Joannes-Boyau, R., Duval, M., Bodin, T., 2017. MCDoseE 2.0 A new Markov Chain Monte Carlo program for ESR dose response curve fitting and dose evaluation. Quaternary Geochronology 44, 1–25. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quageo.2017.11.003

NAME: OCTOPUS
DESCRIPTION: Open cosmogenic nuclide and luminescence data database
CITATION: Codilean, A.T., Munack, H., Cohen, T.J., Saktura, W.M., Gray, A., Mudd, S.M., 2018. OCTOPUS: an open cosmogenic isotope and luminescence database. Earth Syst. Sci. Data 10, 2123–2139. doi: https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-10-2123-2018

NAME: INQUA Dunes Atlas
DESCRIPTION: Collection of luminescence ages from sand dunes world wide
CITATION: Lancaster, N., Wolfe, S., Thomas, D., Bristow, C., Bubenzer, O., Burrough, S., Duller, G., Halfen, A., Hesse, P., Roskin, J., Singhvi, A., Tsoar, H., Tripaldi, A., Yang, X., Zárate, M., 2015. The INQUA Dunes Atlas chronologic database. Quaternary International 410, 3–10. doi: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.quaint.2015.10.044

NAME: AGE
DESCRIPTION: Program for the calculation of luminescence ages estimates
CITATION: http://ancienttl.org/ATL_27-2_2009/ATL_27-2_Grun_p45-46.pdf

NAME: DRc
DESCRIPTION: Dose Rate Calculator  for luminescence and ESR Dating (Java application)
CITATION: Tsakalos, E., Christodoulakis, J., Charalambous, L., 2015. The Dose Rate Calculator (DRc) for Luminescence and ESR Dating-a Java Application for Dose Rate and Age Determination. Archaeometry 58, 347–352. doi: https://doi.org/10.1111/arcm.12162

NAME: gamma
DESCRIPTION: gamma is intended to process in-situ gamma-ray spectrometry measurements for luminescence dating. This package allows to import, inspect and (automatically) correct the energy scale of the spectrum. It provides methods for estimating the gamma dose rate by the use of a calibration curve. This package only supports Canberra CNF and TKA files.
CITATION: Frerebeau, N, Lebrun, B., Guérin, G., Lahaye, C., 2019. gamma: Dose Rate Estimation from In-Situ Gamma-Ray Spectrometry Measurements for Luminescence Dating. http://gamma.archaeo.science,  http://github.com/crp2a/gamma.

NAME: LDAC
DESCRIPTION: A Microsoft Excel Visual Basic for Application (VBA)-based package which can be used to assemble OSL age information and associated calculations. This platform applies statistical models to determine equivalent dose (De) values and render corresponding OSL age estimates. This software is fully applicable for De measurements by single grain and aliquot regeneration (SAR) and thermal transfer OSL (TT-OSL) protocols. It could also be used to calculate the dose rate and final buried age for geology/archaeology samples.
CITATION: Liang, P., Forman, S.L., 2019. LDAC: An Excel-based program for luminescence equivalent dose and burial age calculations. Ancient TL 37, 21–40.

NAME: mcmcSAM
DESCRIPTION: Analyzing statistical age models for equivalent dose and burial age determination using a Markov Chain Monte Carlo method
CITATION: Peng, J., 2020. Analyzing statistical age models to determine the equivalent dose and burial age using a Markov chain Monte Carlo method. Geochronometria 0, 1–14.
